1.content: The sons of wisdom are the church of the just: and their generation, obedience and love.

2.content: Children, hear the judgment of your father, and so do that you may be saved.

3.content: For God hath made the father honourable to the children: and seeking the judgment of the mothers, hath confirmed it upon the children.

4.content: He that loveth God, shall obtain pardon for his sins by prayer, and shall refrain himself from them, and shall be heard in the prayer of days.

5.content: And he that honoureth his mother is as one that layeth up a treasure.

6.content: He that honoureth his father shall have joy in his own children, and in the day of his prayer he shall be heard.

7.content: He that honoureth his father shall enjoy a long life: and he that obeyeth the father, shall be a comfort to his mother.

8.content: He that feareth the Lord, honoureth his parents, and will serve them as his masters that brought him into the world.

9.content: Honour thy father, in work and word, and all patience,

10.content: That a blessing may come upon thee from him, and his blessing may remain in the latter end.

11.content: The father's blessing establisheth the houses of the children: but the mother's curse rooteth up the foundation.

12.content: Glory not in the dishonour of thy father: for his shame is no glory to thee.

13.content: For the glory of a man is from the honour of his father, and a father without honour is the disgrace of the son.

14.content: Son, support the old age of thy father, and grieve him not in his life;

15.content: And if his understanding fail, have patience with him, and despise him not when thou art in thy strength: for the relieving of the father shall not be forgotten.

16.content: For good shall be repaid to thee for the sin of thy mother.

17.content: And in justice thou shalt be built up, and in the day of affliction thou shalt be remembered: and thy sins shall melt away as the ice in the fair warm weather.

18.content: Of what an evil fame is he that forsaketh his father: and he is cursed of God that angereth his mother.

19.content: My son, do thy works in meekness, and thou shalt be beloved above the glory of men.

20.content: The greater thou art, the more humble thyself in all things, and thou shalt find grace before God:

21.content: For great is the power of God alone, and he is honoured by the humble.

22.content: Seek not the things that are too high for thee, and search not into things above thy ability: but the things that God hath commanded thee, think on them always, and in many of his works be not curious.

23.content: For it is not necessary for thee to see with thy eyes those things that are hid.

24.content: In unnecessary matters be not over curious, and in many of his works thou shalt not be inquisitive.

25.content: For many things are shewn to thee above the understanding of men.

26.content: And the suspicion of them hath deceived many, and hath detained their minds in vanity.

27.content: A hard heart shall fear evil at the last: and he that loveth danger shall perish in it.

28.content: A heart that goeth two ways shall not have success, and the perverse of heart shall be scandalized therein.

29.content: A wicked heart shall be laden with sorrows, and the sinner will add sin to sin.

30.content: The congregation of the proud shall not be healed: for the plant of wickedness shall take root in them, and it shall not be perceived.

31.content: The heart of the wise is understood in wisdom, and a good ear will hear wisdom with all desire.

32.content: A wise heart, and which hath understanding, will abstain from sins, and in the works of justice shall have success.

33.content: Water quencheth a flaming fire, and alms resisteth sins:

34.content: And God provideth for him that sheweth favour: he remembereth him afterwards, and in the time of his fall he shall find a sure stay.

disclaimer: This book is an addition to the Old Testament. It is not found in the Hebrew or Aramaic texts, but are found in the Greek Septuagint and the Latin Vulgate.
